column4: when i go to install syslog i get this The following packages will be REMOVED:
Because you're removing the kernel logger, the system logger, and the ubuntu core.
so you're saying i cannot install syslog on ubuntu ?
That package isn't even in the repos. What are you trying to install?
Hmm. If you're installing a different system logger, then it makes sense to remove the old one. Nevermind, then. I thought you were trying to install a regular package.
so it removes programs automatically that would be doing the same thing, preventing conflicts
That's right. apt resolves conflicts and dependencies. That's what makes it useful.
You close whatever's using it? Use fuser -m /media/music to find out what process.
thankyou. that one goes in the command list file
You can also use fuser -mk to kill it right away.
